article_title: Jeffrey Gillespie: Antonin Scalia, ex post facto
article_text: Sign up for our newsletter and have the top headlines from your community delivered right to your inbox.

article_metadata.description: "I have never killed a man, but I have read many obituaries with great pleasure."That quote, by Clarence Darrow, perfectly sums up this columnist's feeling on the demise of Antonin Scalia, Supreme Court justice, lion of the right and scourge of liberal ideas over more than 3 decades on the high court. He died this week, aged 79, at a hunting resort in West Texas.The impact of Scalia's reign reads like an homage to the conservative agenda. During his tenure, the court handed down rulings as
